results.title: Cardioprotection, attenuated systemic inflammation, and survival benefit of beta1-adrenoceptor blockade in severe sepsis in rats.
results.text_hl: MEASUREMENTS AND MAIN RESULTS: Peripheral @GENE_ADRB1 @GENE_24925 @@@beta1-adrenoceptor@@@ blockade established for 2 days before lethal @<m>DISEASE_Endotoxemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D019446 @@@endotoxemia@@@ markedly improved survival in both @CHEMICAL_Metoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008790 @@@metoprolol@@@-treated (n = 16; log rank test, p = .002) and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@-treated (n = 15; p = .03) @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

citations.NLM: Ackland GL, Yao ST, Rudiger A, Dyson A, Stidwill R, Poputnikov D, Singer M, Gourine AV. Cardioprotection, attenuated systemic inflammation, and survival benefit of beta1-adrenoceptor blockade in severe sepsis in rats. Crit Care Med. 2010 Feb;38(2):388-94. PMID: 19829100
